Title: Selfessness ｜ Tao Te Ching Explained ｜ Chapter 7
Content: In the pursuit of leadership roles, it's easy to become consumed by self-interest, seeking validation and security. However, this chapter emphasizes the benefits of selflessness in leadership. By focusing on serving others rather than personal gain, leaders can find fulfillment and stability. It suggests that those who lead not for personal gain but for the benefit of those they serve often find themselves in positions of authority naturally. This approach not only leads to greater satisfaction but also to a more harmonious and effective leadership style. Remember, leadership is not about personal validation but about serving others effectively.
